concise_definition: v. 消失, 消逝, 消亡 (disappear 的现在分词形式)

definitions.explanation_en: To cease to be visible, present, or detectable; to vanish from sight, existence, or awareness, often suddenly or mysteriously.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指不再可见、存在或可察觉；突然或神秘地从视线、存在或意识中消失。
definitions.example_en: The magician made the rabbit disappear in a puff of smoke.
definitions.example_cn: 魔术师在一团烟雾中让兔子消失了。

definitions.explanation_en: To gradually cease to exist or function, especially due to neglect, change, or external pressures; often used for species, traditions, or languages.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由于忽视、变化或外部压力而逐渐消亡，常用于指物种、传统或语言的灭绝。
definitions.example_en: Many indigenous languages are disappearing as younger generations adopt dominant dialects.
definitions.example_cn: 随着年轻一代采用主流方言，许多土著语言正在逐渐消失。

definitions.explanation_en: To fade away or become less noticeable over time, such as a sound, memory, or emotion.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指随着时间推移逐渐减弱或变得不明显，如声音、记忆或情感。
definitions.example_en: The sound of the train was disappearing into the distance.
definitions.example_cn: 火车的声音正渐渐消失在远方。

comparison.analysis: “Vanishing” 与 “disappearing” 几乎可以互换，都表示“消失”，但 “vanishing” 更常用于强调神秘、突然或不可思议的消失，带有更强的文学或戏剧色彩。而 “disappearing” 更中性、通用，可用于日常语境。
“Fading” (褪色/减弱) 强调逐渐变淡、减弱的过程，通常指颜色、声音、记忆或情感的缓慢消退，而非彻底消失。而 “disappearing” 更倾向于完全从存在或感知中移除，过程可能迅速或彻底。
“Evaporating” (蒸发/消散) 常用于比喻液体或抽象事物（如信心、机会）像水汽一样迅速无痕地消失，带有物理或化学隐喻。它比 “disappearing” 更具形象性，常用于强调不可挽回或无形的消逝。
